Issues.Title: ByteViewer is not DPI-aware
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

When using 150% windows scaling, the font renders bigger in ByteViewer, but the actual offsets and borders remain the same, so it draws on top of each other.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dd2d9d7b-450e-4cee-ac64-ad3bb6dbf516)

### Steps to reproduce

```csharp
new System.ComponentModel.Design.ByteViewer
{
    Dock = DockStyle.Fill,
};
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ByteViewer is not DPI-aware" (#13219)

Issues.Title: Address issues with this repo's Auto-Labeler
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Address issues with this repo's Auto-Labeler" (#13214)

Issues.Title: The VB WinForm project shows ENC0005 error while debugging in VS 2022 and using hot reload.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET SDK 10.0.100-PREVIEW.4.25177.19

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

The issue can reproduce from .NET 6.0 to latest .NET SDK 10.0

### Issue description

The VB WinForm project shows ENC0005 error while debugging in VS 2022 and using hot reload.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d1c768ed-1dae-4936-921c-2b736770e0a6)

**.NET VB:**

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/14408404-479d-41b0-9e05-b937c1946949

**Framework VB:**

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/10e7f064-ad71-415f-a0e5-3e0c774de2c4

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a .NET Framework 4.8, VB, WinForm project in VS 2022(17.13.3).
2. From Toolbox, drag a Button to the Form1, double click this button and navigate to the “button.click” code.
3. Add “Debug.Write(“Hello”)” code line and set a breakpoint on this line.
4. Add the `<Deterministic>false</Deterministic> `in the .vbproj file, and save
5. In Solution Explorer, click Show All Files button, expand My Project node, click to open AssemblyInfo.vb file.
6. Scroll down, comment the <Assembly: AssemblyFileVersion("1.0.0.0")> line, change the <Assembly: AssemblyVersion("1.0.0.0")> to for example <Assembly: AssemblyVersion("2.0.*")>. Note to use the wildcard *.
Or use the attached reproduce application: 
[ReproApplication.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19533310/ReproApplication.zip)
7. Save the project and navigate to the breakpoint that you set originally, in Form1.vb file. click Start to start debugging.
8. Comment the “Debug.Write(“Hello”)” code line, and click hot reload button, you will see error message like “Updating the Handles clause of method requires restarting the application.” However, if you don’t use the wildcard * for AssemblyVersion, this issue won’t appear.

**More info:**
1. The issue cannot reproduce C# winforms type project
2. The issue cannot reproduce VB Console type project
3. Original feedback link: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/The-VB-WinForm-project-shows-ENC0005-err/10875798?viewtype=all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The VB WinForm project shows ENC0005 error while debugging in VS 2022 and using hot reload." (#13213)

Issues.Title: PropertyGrid Toolstrip - ToolStripButtons Selected Border Mouse Over
Issues.Body:
**.NET Core Version:**
9.0.201

**Did it work in .NET Framework?**
Yes

**Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core?**
No response


**Environment Details:**
App name: .NET Core Winforms
Window Version: Win 11
OS Build: 10.0.26100.3624

**More info**
The issue is visible when focus a ToolStripButton with mouse (it draws the keyborad focus as well)
Tried to bypass via custom renderer, not working.

**Repro Steps:**

1. Create a form with a PropertyGrid.
2. Select the main form as "Selected Object"
3. Run the application.
4. Set focus with the mouse on a non selected ToolStripButton.

**Expected behavior:**
Only "Selected" border is visible, on mouse over

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fa7a4130-4554-4442-bca2-6eda0e958b96)

**Actual behavior:**
Selected border and Keyboard focus are visble, on mouse over

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b700ba0f-3f0c-4706-bb5b-b47d04fb9ce1)

Issues.Title: Designer and Visual Studio disagree of Float Format
Issues.Body:
### Environment

N/A

### .NET version

NA

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

NA

### Issue description

Designer express floats an 12F VS as 12.0F normally this wouldn’t matter but because of #13170 in order to fix that the designer file needs to be hand edited as the format changed then when VS designed edits it it changes back. 

### Steps to reproduce

Open any designer file with a Size, edit it and when you save all the floats are changed. Save to GitHub. Open in designer, edit anything as save and compare previous. 

### Diagnostics

```text

```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Designer and Visual Studio disagree of Float Format" (#13201)

Issues.Title: VS2022 DesignToolServer Goes Rouge  3GB ram usage 50mb/s Disk Usage
Issues.Body:
### Description

sorry to write here. but you left me no chose . -- ""report issue" button  in the vs Studio doesnt work.. it says cant login.. thus cant report the actual issue

**please forward this to there..**
i clicked inside visual studio  -> report issue -website opens.. pressed login says ""Cant login"" red text..

----------
**testproject:**  [testApp_.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19511709/testApp_.zip)

i was working on Stack-layout  for winforms. - updated Layout  couple of times..  

**MY PC:** 8gb ram.  + ssd -   intel gen12 - i5

**Actual issue**

 i am developing  SharpBrowser/SharpBrowser   on Winforms , .net8 , VisualStudio 2022 - v17.13.4 



* i noticed subtle lags.  at first, i thought it was firefox.. 
* restarted Firefox.
  
 after 1 2 minutes lag was really obvius .. Freezes become 2 3 seconds long.

 * i restart VS2022 itself. 

still laggy.


* then  i  opened Cotnrol Panel.
   * DesignerServer.exe hit 3gb ram usage , and  50mb/sec. 
   * i waited 1 minutes . will it go down.? 
   * **NO** its   dancing around 2gb to 3gb Ram -- 30 - 50mb/s DiskUsage.
   *  then i killed that big 3gb designerServerTool.exe
   * killed VS2022 
   * waited 10 seconds
   * reopened   vs2022 ..
   * problem is gone..

**so problem is**: 
DesignerServerTool.exe gone Rouge...  de-attached itself form visualStudio.exe " i saw that , but coundn't ScreenCapture it..   the photo is portrays what i saw. with my eyes."
 


![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9c3da8c5-38b2-4644-a6ad-05b2a114e817)

-----------


**follow up of Restarting**: 
after restart vs2022  - 4 hours passed - still using VS22 -still good. - no problem happened.

*may be this is hard to trigger ERROR..*

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a1819c31-e764-4dd1-aaeb-3374fadbc3a2)

Issues.Title: StackOverFlowException should be popped up when errorProvider with a large size icon: 256*256
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 10.0 SDK build: 10.0.100-preview.4.25177.19

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, cannot repro in previous .NET versions, regressed from .NET 10.0 Preview 4, cannot repro in .NET 10.0 Preview 3.

### Issue description

StackOverFlowException cannot be popped up when errorProvider with a large size icon: 256*256

**.NET 10**: when running app, cannot get StackOverFlowException and runtime form

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a2450276-149e-4e37-ad7a-5162b4115468

**.NET 9 and .NET framework 4.8.1**: get StackOverFlowException when running app

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7603db13-0569-4dc8-aea2-0bda2b73c29d)
_System.StackOverflowException
  HResult=0x800703E9
  Source=<Cannot evaluate the exception source>
  StackTrace:
<Cannot evaluate the exception stack trace>_

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/58696f24-fb4c-4c1b-bcbe-fc4adc937ef9

### Steps to reproduce

Repro steps:
1. Create a Winforms .NET 10 app with TextBox and ErrorProvider added
2. Give a large icon with 256*256 size for errorProvider's Icon property
3. Double-click form designer, SetError for textBox in Form1_Load event
 ```
private void Form1_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)
{
  errorProvider1.SetError(textBox1, "testing");
}
```
4. Build and run application

or use this sample app: [WinFormsApp31.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19499748/WinFormsApp31.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "StackOverFlowException should be popped up when errorProvider with a large size icon: 256*256" (#13199)

Issues.Title: MSHTML memory leak in NET9
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

NET9

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, the problem is not present in NET8

### Issue description
This is an issue as created on https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/MSHTML-control-memory-leak-with-NET9/10880632 as well. But I was not sure whether that was the correct place to start.

## Background
We have a WinForms 32-bits call center application where customers report app crashes/hangs and they have to kill it, or it simply vanishes without any notification, which seems to coincide with our NET9 migration.
After restarting it just works again. This seems to happen every 1-1.5 hours (or 120-160 calls the processed) depending on the length of the calls mostly.

## Analysis
We noticed after going back to the version before the NET9 upgrade the issue vanishes so it seems related to NET9, or any changes in MSHTML for NET9?

After further investigation we noticed it is around 120-160 calls having been processed by the agent.
Our testing environment can fake calls and auto-process them so we could reproduce it by letting this testing environment run. It took around 30 minutes to crash.
On each call there is a navigate using an embedded MSHTML control to a start url for the call script. 
On each navigate we traverse the DOM, retrieving all INPUT, SELECT, LABEL and TEXTAREA elements and
filling them with data from our database.

Running in the debugger we sometimes get an out-of-memory exception, or the process just hangs, or closes like the production application. 
When running in the debugger the Diagnostic View shows memory increasing constantly. Since we run a win-x86 executable (for reasons :-| ) the crash occurs at 1.5-1.6GB of memory.

It seems this memory leak in combination with navigates in the MSHTML control and DOM traversals started with NET9, as running it with NET8 memory does not grow (at all) and can run all-day withou problems. 
In NET9 depending on the length of calls (ie. number of calls/hour) a crash happens after around 1-1.5 hours.

### Steps to reproduce

## Reproduction
We created a small test application that does the main things that lead to the memory leak/crash. This application will crash in about 5 minutes. See https://github.com/jbennink/repro-mshtml-memory-leak-net9

We also support WebView2, when switching to that browser engine the memory leak does not occur in NET9, which is obvious since it is completely different. However due to several customers running custom call scripts with 
embedded vbscript (yes really) we still have to support MSHTML, which itself is supported until 2029.

And returning to net8.0 the issue is also gone with MSHTML.

In instances the process continues running, but the window does not respond anymore, indicating that the embedded webbrowser has crashed internally. 
Memory does not increase in that situation either.
Also sometimes the process crashes with an out-of-memory exception where the VS debugger (Diagnostics view) says the process memory is much less than 1,6GB. 
Most of the times it crashes when the Diagnostics windows says 1,6GB.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MSHTML memory leak in NET9" (#13195)

Issues.Title: TreeView icons are not scaled on high DPI
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET 9.0.2 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? No. Issue https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6380 claims this was fixed in .NET 7. However, the issue was not fixed, and the same sample app from that issue continues to reproduce the issue. ### Issue description Icons on TreeView nodes stay small when using high DPI. ### Steps to reproduce Download the repro from issue #6380: [TreeViewImagesBug.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/7756112/TreeViewImagesBug.zip). Update the TFM to .NET 9 and run it. Note that the tree view icons are the same size at 200% and 100% DPI. (The below screenshots should appear approximately to-scale.)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TreeView icons are not scaled on high DPI" (#13194)

Issues.Title: Default text is blank when add new menu item through Collection Editor
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 10 preview 3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Not tested because other version blocked by issue https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/3142

### Issue description

**Current Behavior (Run Time)** 
In Runtime, the default text for added menu item is blank.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ccbc4ff8-a5d2-44c0-8f64-f39c5410b166

**Expected Behavior (Design Time)**
In Design time, the default text for added menu item is not blank.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7858d9c6-366f-44a6-be6c-ff900270af73

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a WinForms Project.
2. Add a MenuStrip and a PropertyGrid to the form.
3. Set PropertyGrid Selected Object as MenuStrip.
4. Run the project.
5. Navigate to Items property and open Collection Editor .
6. Click Add and observe the Text property of the added menuItem.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Default text is blank when add new menu item through Collection Editor" (#13191)
